result.execSummary:
The defendant Mikayla M. Korman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
No early termination of probation. 
Probation may transfer to Milwaukee County if they accept.
Comply with A & R - Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
DOC COLLECT
Pay restitution in the amount of $6,672.00 and restitution surcharges.  Restitution awarded to J.R..
No alcohol. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. 
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

IT IS ORDERED, pursuant to Wis. Stats. Sec. 973.015, that upon successful completion of the sentence imposed, as evidenced by receipt by this Court of a Certificate of Discharge from the probationary authority, the Clerk of Court shall issue an order expunging the record.

timeConds.notes:
**AMENDMENT 7/1/22 - to reflect new turn in date on conditional jail time of 8/1/2022 @ 8:00 am.**

to commence on or before 7-16-2022 at 8:00 a.m. with work release privileges. 

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence. 

Defendant shall report to the jail on time and with no detectable amount of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription, or defendant will forfeit Huber/work release for a period of 5 days, unless reinstated by the court.
Complete 50 hours of community service work for each year of probation ordered without buyout option.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mikayla M. Korman

records.addlTxt: Defense Letter Requesting Amendment to JOC - that's fine. KED 7/1/22
Order for Community Service
BOND QUASHED
Application for Jail Time Credit form

9:01 AM Case called. Prosecuting attorney Zeke S Wiedenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mikayla M. Korman in court.  Attorney Ashley L Renz in court for Mikayla M. Korman. 
Atty Renz recites agreement, guilty to count 1 in 22CF154, remaining counts are dismissed and read in, withheld sentence and 3 years of probation; 15 days jail with work release, court costs, no alcohol, no drugs, or drug paraphernalia, not to drive without a valid driver's license, 6 month drivers license revocation, restitution of $6,672.00, 50 hours of CS, no buyout and for each year of probation, counseling as recommended, assessment and rehabilitation, DNA sample and surcharge, no early termination of probation, expungement upon successful completion of probation.  
Deft enters guilty plea to count 1. 
Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty. 
Plea is freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently made. 
Court gives warning to deportation. 
Atty Renz asks for 60 days until jail to start. 
Probation can transfer to Milwaukee County if they accept it. 
Report date is July 16, 2022.

Defendant Mikayla M. Korman in court.  Attorney Ashley L Renz in court for Mikayla M. Korman.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mikayla M. Korman in court.  Attorney Ashley L Renz in court for Mikayla M. Korman. Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter Requesting Phone Appearance
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.

2:20 PM - Defendant Mikayla M. Korman appeared by phone.  Attorney Ashley L Renz in court for Mikayla M. Korman.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives her right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Arraignment held in open court.
Attorney Renz acknowledged the receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to the charge on behalf of her client.
Speedy Trial is reserved.
Status conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Mikayla M. Korman appeared in court, in custody by video, Attorney Ashley L Renz for Mikayla M. Korman appeared in court. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the attorney. Rights given and hearing requested, within time period. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

J.J. Crawford appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Mikayla Marie Korman appeared in court, in custody by video with Attorney Leah Selmek for bond purposes only. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Right to attorney options form given; referred to spd. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Leah Selmek, denied. Bond remains. Bond set over the weekend. Defendant listed as runaway out of Milwaukee. State objects to modifying bond. State has fleeing referral also. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Order to seal notice of arrest
Notice of Arrest
Signed bond filed with the court.
see signature bond for conditions

MUST POST $1,000 CASH.
Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH J.R.M. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
